questions.solutionText: Time flies without you knowing it.

questions.questionText: When did Al-Khwarizmi write the popular book which introduced Indian numbers and zero to the Arab world?
questions.solutionText: Al-Khwarizmi's popularizing treatise on algebra presented the first systematic solution of linear and quadratic equations.

questions.questionText: Who wrote “Liber Abaci” which introduced the Indian number system and zero to Europe?
questions.solutionText: Leonardo Fibonacci brought this system to Europe. His book Liber Abaci introduced Arabic numerals to the Latin world.
questions.hintText: It is also known as Leonardo Bonacci, Leonardo of Pisa.

questions.questionText: It is defined as the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter.
questions.solutionText: Succinctly, pi, is the ratio of the circumference of any circle to the diameter of that circle.

questions.questionText: Which of the following numbers are divisible by 9?
questions.solutionText: The sum of numbers 7, 3, and 8 is equal to 18. 18 divided by 9 is equal to 2. Therefore 738 is divisible by 9.
questions.hintText: A number is divisible by 9 if the sum of the digits is divisible by 9.

questions.questionText: How many sides does a dodecagon have?
questions.solutionText: Also known as 12-gon, a dodecagon is any polygon with twelve (yes, twelve!) sides.
questions.hintText: "Ferris wheels in ""peryas"" of the Philippines are usually dodecagons!"

questions.questionText: Any number greater than zero that is raised to zero is equal to?
questions.solutionText: Any number raised to zero power is equal to one.
questions.hintText: All numbers disappeared and only one has remained.

questions.questionText: Each row in Pascal's Triangle starts with what number?
questions.solutionText: "In mathematics, Pascal's triangle is an array of the binomial coefficients that arises in probability theory, combinatorics, and algebra.
questions.hintText: All of us have to start at step 1, or else we would struggle.

questions.solutionText: "Thomas Harriot invented the signs for ""greater than"" (>) and ""less than"" (<) in use today."
questions.hintText: An English astronomer, mathematician, ethnographer and translator who made advances within the scientific field.

questions.questionText: Riddle: If a hen and a half lay an egg and a half in a day and a half, how many eggs will half a dozen hens lay in half a dozen days?
